verbs.description: hotkey (third-person singular simple present hotkeys, present participle hotkeying, simple past and past participle hotkeyed)

entries.meaning: (computing, intransitive) To navigate by means of a keyboard shortcut.
examples: All of the sales talk about hotkeying between 3270 sessions and DOS applications sounds great until you try to squeeze the DOS applications into the PC while it's emulating a terminal.
